intro: Brassica campestris subvar. ulti, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and is native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The seeds are small, spherical, and can remain viable in the soil for several years.
